破.definition: broken; damaged; worn out; lousy; rotten; to break, split or cleave; to get rid of; to destroy; to break with; to defeat; to capture (a city etc); to expose the truth of

破冰.definition: (fig.) to break the ice; to begin to restore amicable relations

破口.definition: tear or rupture; to have a tear (e.g. in one's clothes); without restraint (e.g. of swearing)

破口大罵.definition: (idiom) to let out a torrent of abuse

破四舊.definition: Destroy the Four Olds (campaign of the Cultural Revolution)

破土.definition: to break ground; to start digging; to plough; to break through the ground (of seedling); fig. the start of a building project

破壁.definition: dilapidated wall; to break through a wall; (fig.) to break through; (biotechnology) to disrupt cell walls; cell disruption

破壞.definition: destruction; damage; to wreck; to break; to destroy

破天荒.definition: unprecedented; for the first time; never before; first ever

破屋又遭連夜雨.pinyin: po4 wu1 you4 zao1 lian2 ye4 yu3
破屋又遭連夜雨.definition: see 屋漏偏逢連夜雨|屋漏偏逢连夜雨[wu1 lou4 pian1 feng2 lian2 ye4 yu3]

破戒.definition: to violate a religious precept; to smoke or drink after giving up

破折號.definition: dash; Chinese dash ── (punct., double the length of the western dash)

破敗.definition: to defeat; to crush (in battle); beaten; ruined; destroyed; in decline

破格.definition: to break the rule; to make an exception

破浪.definition: to set sail; to brave the waves

破涕為笑.definition: to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness

破滅.definition: to be shattered; to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)

破爛.definition: worn-out; dilapidated; tattered; ragged; (coll.) rubbish; junk

破獲.definition: to uncover (a criminal plot); to break open and capture

破瓜.definition: (of a girl) to lose one's virginity; to deflower a virgin; to reach the age of 16; (of a man) to reach the age of 64

破瓦寒窯.definition: lit. broken tiles, cold hearth; fig. a broken-down house; poor and shabby dwelling

破產.definition: to go bankrupt; to become impoverished; bankruptcy

破發.definition: (of a stock) to fall below the issue price; (of a tennis player) to break serve (abbr. for 破發球局|破发球局[po4 fa1 qiu2 ju2])

破的.definition: to hit the target; (fig.) to hit the nail on the head

破相.definition: (of facial features) to be marred by a scar etc; to disfigure; to make a fool of oneself

破碎.definition: to smash to pieces; to shatter

破碗破摔.definition: lit. to smash a cracked pot; fig. to treat oneself as hopeless and act crazily

破竹之勢.definition: lit. a force to smash bamboo (idiom); fig. irresistible force

破竹建瓴.definition: lit. smash bamboo, overturn water tank (idiom); fig. irresistible force

破綻百出.definition: (of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)

破繭成蝶.definition: lit. to break through a cocoon and turn into a butterfly (idiom); fig. to emerge strong after a period of struggle; to get to a better place after going through difficult period

破罐破摔.definition: lit. to smash a pot just because it has a crack (idiom); fig. to give up altogether after a setback; to throw one's hands up in frustration and let it all go to hell

破膽寒心.definition: to be scared out of one's wits

破舊立新.definition: to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate

破處.definition: to break the hymen; to lose virginity

破蛹.definition: to emerge from a pupa (of a butterfly etc)

破裂.definition: to burst; to rupture; (of a relationship etc) to break down

破解.definition: to break (a bond, constraint etc); to explain; to unravel; to decipher; to decode; to crack (software)

破讀.definition: pronunciation of a character other than the standard; lit. broken reading

破財免災.definition: a financial loss may prevent disaster (idiom)

破釜沉舟.definition: lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat; to burn one's boats

破鏡.definition: broken mirror; fig. broken marriage; divorce

破鏡重圓.definition: lit. the two halves of the broken mirror are rejoined (idiom); fig. long-separated lovers are reunited; a broken relationship is restored

破門.definition: to burst or force open a door; to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church); to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)

破門而入.definition: to break the door down and enter (idiom)

破關.definition: to solve or overcome (a difficult problem); to beat (a video game)

破防.definition: (video games) to break through an opponent's defenses; (by extension) (slang) to get to sb; to make sb feel upset or moved

破除.definition: to eliminate; to do away with; to get rid of

破鞋.definition: broken shoes; worn-out footwear; loose woman; slut

破音字.definition: character with two or more readings; character where different readings convey different meanings (Tw)

破題.definition: writing style in which the main subject is approached directly from the outset; opposite of 冒題|冒题[mao4 ti2]

破顏.definition: to break into a smile; (of flowers) to open

破體字.definition: nonstandard or corrupted form of a Chinese character
